snippet: Vertical Capital forbade its marketing chief to reveal that its founder and related brokerage firm were the subject of a securities investigation.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column relates case in which Vertical Capital marketing chief Miriam Freier was barred from telling investors that firm and its founder Brett Graham were under fraud investigation by Securities and Exchange Commission; observes that Freier was unwilling to comply with order, and was eventually fired; argues that case highlights need for better disclosure requirements by the SEC, as well as the importance of protections for whistle-blowers.
lead_paragraph: Vertical Capital forbade its marketing chief to reveal that its founder and related brokerage firm were the subject of a securities investigation.

headline.main: Hedge Fund Kept U.S. Inquiry Quiet
